problem_text:
21.95. Is there an almost simple but not simple group which is recognizable by the isomorphism type of its Gruenberg–Kegel graph?
Note that if a group G is recognizable by the isomorphism type of its Gruenberg–Kegel graph, then G is recognizable by its Gruenberg–Kegel graph, and therefore G is almost simple (P. J. Cameron, N. V. Maslova, J. Algebra, 607 (2022), 186–213).
N. V. Maslova
